chief.note: Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on February 12, 1884, after confirmation. Commissioned or accredited to Santo Domingo.

Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on January 13, 1886, after confirmation. Transmitted a copy of his credentials by mail from Port-au-Prince on, July 20, 1885. Commissioned or accredited to Santo Domingo. Commissioned to Haiti only on the dates indicated and also accredited (but not commissioned) to Santo Domingo under the terms of the acts making appropriations for the diplomatic and consular service of the United States.

Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on December 16, 1889, after confirmation. Commissioned or accredited to Santo Domingo. Commissioned to Haiti only on the dates indicated and also accredited (but not commissioned) to Santo Domingo under the terms of the acts making appropriations for the diplomatic and consular service of the United States.

Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on December 23, 1891, after confirmation. Commissioned or accredited to Santo Domingo. Commissioned to Haiti only on the dates indicated and also accredited (but not commissioned) to Santo Domingo under the terms of the acts making appropriations for the diplomatic and consular service of the United States.

started.note: Credentials presented by Smythe's predecessor on

chief.note: Commissioned or accredited to Santo Domingo. Commissioned to Haiti only on the dates indicated and also accredited (but not commissioned) to Santo Domingo under the terms of the acts making appropriations for the diplomatic and consular service of the United States. Smythe was officially received in person at Santo Domingo on October 28, 1895.

Commissioned or accredited to Santo Domingo. Commissioned to Haiti only on the dates indicated and also accredited (but not commissioned) to Santo Domingo under the terms of the acts making appropriations for the diplomatic and consular service of the United States. Officially received on February 18, 1898.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on December 8, 1904, after confirmation. Commissioned or accredited to Santo Domingo.
Commissioned or accredited to Santo Domingo.

ended.note: Promoted to Envoy Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary

chief.note: Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on December 17, 1915, after confirmation.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on December 17, 1925, after confirmation.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on December 17, 1931, after confirmation.

ended.note: Promoted to Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary
The United States severed diplomatic relations with the Dominican Republic on

chief.note: The new Government of the Dominican Republic was still unrecognized by the United States when Martin left post on September 28, 1963.
Took oath of office, but did not proceed to post.
